intro: Dewevrea bilabiata, commonly known as the broad-leaved dewevrea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
